org.jcatapult.jpa
Class JPAPersistenceService

java.lang.Object
  org.jcatapult.jpa.JPAPersistenceService
All Implemented Interfaces:
PersistenceService
public class JPAPersistenceService
extends Object
implements PersistenceService

This class is the default implementation of the PersistenceService and provides default JPA behavior. It requires that the EntityManagerContext be constructed correctly using the filter as described in that classes comments (click on the link and read up on how to setup the filter).

Constructor Summary

          Constructs a new JPAPersistenceService that uses the given EntityManager to communicate with the database.

Method Detail

setVerifyEntityClasses

public void setVerifyEntityClasses(boolean verifyEntityClasses)

clearCache

public void clearCache()
This is mostly a hack to get around Hibernate's sometimes aggrevating caching. This clears any persistence cache that the implementation behind this interface might have. This forces any objects that are fetched to come directly from the database.

Specified by:
clearCache in interface PersistenceService

reload

public void reload(Object obj)
This forces the given Object to be reloaded from the database.

Specified by:
reload in interface PersistenceService
Parameters:
obj - The object to reload.

contains

public boolean contains(Object obj)
Determines if the given object is a managed JPA entity inside the current EntityManager context.

Specified by:
contains in interface PersistenceService
Parameters:
obj - The Object to determine if it is managed or not.
Returns:
True if the Object is managed, false if it is detached.

startTransaction

public Transaction startTransaction()
Starts a new EntityTransaction if the current EntityManager doesn't already have an active transaction. If it does have an active transaction, then it still creates a transaction but it is a proxy that will ignore commit and rollback calls since it is effectively an outer transaction.

Specified by:
startTransaction in interface PersistenceService
Returns:
The transaction.

lock

public void lock(Object obj,
                 boolean read)
Locks the object using the JPA EntityManager.lock(Object,LockModeType) method on the entity manager.

Specified by:
lock in interface PersistenceService
Parameters:
obj - The object to lock.
read - The read flag to determine the lock mode.

findAllByType

public <T> List<T> findAllByType(Class<T> type)
This locates all instances of an Object by class. This could be extremely heavy weight if the number of Objects of the type are large. Therefore, only use this method when you know that the total number of Object instances in the DB is low.

Specified by:
findAllByType in interface PersistenceService
Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
Returns:
A List of the Objects found in the database.

findAllByType

public <T extends SoftDeletable> List<T> findAllByType(Class<T> type,
                                                       boolean includeDeleted)
This locates all instances of an Object by class. This could be extremely heavy weight if the number of Objects of the type are large. Therefore, only use this method when you know that the total number of Object instances in the DB is low.

Specified by:
findAllByType in interface PersistenceService
Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
includeDeleted - Determines if this should return all the instances of the Object including those instances that are marked as deleted and are SoftDeletable objects.
Returns:
A List of the Objects found in the database.

findAllByTypeInternal

protected <T> List<T> findAllByTypeInternal(Class<T> type,
                                            boolean includeDeleted)
This is the internal method that performs the find but also determines if the Object is a SoftDeletable and appends "where eb.deleted = false" if the includeDeleted is false.

Parameters:
type - The type to find.
includeDeleted - Determines if this should return all the instances of the Object including those instances that are marked as deleted and are SoftDeletable objects.
Returns:
The list.

count

public <T> long count(Class<T> type)
Determines the total number of instances of the type given. If these are SoftDeletable Objects, this will include all the deleted objects as well.

Specified by:
count in interface PersistenceService
Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to count.
Returns:
A total number of Objects in the database.

A total number of Objects in the database.

findByType

public <T> List<T> findByType(Class<T> type,
                              int start,
                              int number)
This locates a subset of all the instances of an Object by class. This helps when paginating over all of the instances of a specific type.

Specified by:
findByType in interface PersistenceService
Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
start - The location in the total set of possible Objects to start from. This is zero based.
number - The number of results to return in this page.
Returns:
A List of the Objects found in the database.

findByType

public <T extends SoftDeletable> List<T> findByType(Class<T> type,
                                                    int start,
                                                    int number,
                                                    boolean includeInactive)
This locates a subset of all the instances of an Object by class. This helps when paginating over all of the instances of a specific type.

Specified by:
findByType in interface PersistenceService
Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
start - The location in the total set of possible Objects to start from. This is zero based.
number - The number of results to return in this page.
includeInactive - Determines if this should return all the instances of the Object including those instances that are marked as deleted and are SoftDeletable objects.
Returns:
A List of the Objects found in the database.

findByTypeInternal

protected <T> List<T> findByTypeInternal(Class<T> type,
                                         int start,
                                         int number,
                                         boolean includeDeleted)
This is the internal method that handles finding by type. If the type is SoftDeletable this and the includeInactive flag is false method also appends "where eb.active = true" to the query.

Parameters:
type - The type to find.
start - The start location within the results for pagination.
number - The number to fetch.
includeDeleted - Determines if this should return all the instances of the Object including those instances that are marked as deleted and are SoftDeletable objects.
Returns:
The list of objects found.

queryAll

public <T> List<T> queryAll(Class<T> type,
                            String query,
                            Object... params)
Executes the given query and returns all of the results from the query.

Specified by:
queryAll in interface PersistenceService
Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
query - The EJB3 query language query string.
params - A list of parameters that are parameterized within the query string (e.g. select user from User user where firstName = ?1). These are 1 based within the query String.
Returns:
A List of the Objects found in the database.

query

public <T> List<T> query(Class<T> type,
                         String query,
                         int start,
                         int number,
                         Object... params)
Executes the given query and returns a subset of the results from the query. This method is useful for paginating over a search results from a query.

Specified by:
query in interface PersistenceService
Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
query - The EJB3 query language query string.
start - The location in the total set of possible Objects to start from. This is zero based.
number - The number of results to return in this page.
params - A list of parameters that are parameterized within the query string (e.g. select user from User user where firstName = ?1). These are 1 based within the query String.
Returns:
A List of the Objects found in the database.

queryFirst

public <T> T queryFirst(Class<T> type,
                        String query,
                        Object... params)
Executes the given query and returns the first result from the query.

Specified by:
queryFirst in interface PersistenceService
Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
query - The EJB3 query language query string.
params - A list of parameters that are parameterized within the query string (e.g. select user from User user where firstName = ?1). These are 1 based within the query String.
Returns:
The first result if there are 1 or more results, otherwise null.

queryCount

public long queryCount(String query,
                       Object... params)
Executes the given query and returns the count. This assumees that the query is a count query rather than a object query.

Specified by:
queryCount in interface PersistenceService
Parameters:
query - The EJB3 query language query string that returns a count.
params - A list of parameters that are parameterized within the query string (e.g. select user from User user where firstName = ?). These are 1 based within the query String.
Returns:
The number of results that executing the query would return.

public <T extends Identifiable> T findById(Class<T> type,
                                           int id)
Locates the entity with the given type and primary key (id).

Specified by:
findById in interface PersistenceService
Parameters:
type - The type of Object to fetch.
id - The primary key of the Object to fetch.
Returns:
The Object or null if it doesn't exist.

persist

public boolean persist(Object obj)
Saves or updates the object to the database.

Specified by:
persist in interface PersistenceService
Parameters:
obj - The object to persist.
Returns:
True if the object was persisted. False if the object was not persisted because of a unique key constraint.

delete

public <T extends Identifiable> boolean delete(Class<T> type,
                                               int id)
Removes the object with the given type and primary key. Since this uses a primary key to remove the instance, this method will only work with identified instances. In addition, if the object type passed in is SoftDeletable than this method will update the active flag and perform an update rather than a delete.

Specified by:
delete in interface PersistenceService
Parameters:
type - The type of Object to remove.
id - The primary key of the Object to remove.
Returns:
True if the entity was removed, false if it wasn't because it doesn't exist.

delete

public void delete(Object obj)
Removes the given object. If the object type passed in is SoftDeletable than this method will update the active flag and perform an update rather than a delete.

Specified by:
delete in interface PersistenceService
Parameters:
obj - The Object to remove.

verify

protected void verify(Class<?> type)
Ensures that the entity class contains the correct annotation to be persisted.

Parameters:
type - The entity type to check.
Throws:
PersistenceException - If the class is missing the Entity annotation.

stripPackage

protected String stripPackage(Class<?> type)
Strips the package name to create a JPA persistable name that can be used in EJB-QL. For example:
ClassReturn
org.jcatapult.project.domain.PhotoPhoto
org.jcatapult.project.FooFoo
NoPackageClassNoPackageClass

Parameters:
type - The class to strip the package name from the fully qualified class name.
Returns:
The name.

addParams

protected void addParams(Query q,
                         Object... params)
Sets the given parameters to the query. These are positional parameters not named parameters.

Parameters:
q - The Query to set the parameters into.
params - The parameters to set as positional parameters into the query.
